Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hydrocortisone for Prevention of Postoperative Delirium in Digestive Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants are randomly assigned to receive either 500 mg HC or placebo intravenously before surgery.

Participants.evidence: patients aged 65 and older undergoing digestive surgery at three hospitals in Japan

Intervention.evidence: Participants are randomly assigned to receive either 500 mg HC or placebo intravenously before surgery.

Objective.evidence: This trial evaluates the effectiveness of hydrocortisone (HC) in preventing POD.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome is the incidence of POD from postoperative days 1 to 3, assessed using the Confusion Assessment Method-ICU (CAM-ICU).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation is stratified by age, sex, disease stage, and procedure type, with allocation concealed via a web-based system.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding includes patients, surgeons, anaesthesiologists, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: As of May 2025, 61 of the planned 180 participants have been enrolled.

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events have been reported.

Funding.evidence: The trial is supported by Nagoya University Hospital.
